item.title: Third-Order Nonlinear Hall Effect in Altermagnet ${\mathrm{RuO}}_{2}$
item.description:
Author(s): R. Y. Chu, L. Han, Z. H. Gong, X. Z. Fu, H. Bai, S. X. Liang, C. Chen, S-W. Cheong, Y. Y. Zhang, J. W. Liu, Y. Y. Wang, F. Pan, H. Z. Lu, and C. Song

Experimental demonstration of the third-order nonlinear Hall effect in RuO2 thin films provides a fingerprint for identifying altermagnets.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 216703] Published Mon Nov 17, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): R. Y. Chu, L. Han, Z. H. Gong, X. Z. Fu, H. Bai, S. X. Liang, C. Chen, S-W. Cheong, Y. Y. Zhang, J. W. Liu, Y. Y. Wang, F. Pan, H. Z. Lu, and C. Song

Experimental demonstration of the third-order nonlinear Hall effect in RuO2 thin films provides a fingerprint for identifying altermagnets.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 216703] Published Mon Nov 17, 2025

item.title: Unmasking Charge Transfer in the Misfits: ARPES and Ab Initio Prediction of Electronic Structure in Layered Incommensurate Systems without Artificial Strain
item.description:
Author(s): Drake Niedzielski, Brendan D. Faeth, Berit H. Goodge, Mekhola Sinha, Tyrel M. McQueen, Lena F. Kourkoutis, and Tomás A. Arias

Common belief is that the large band shifts observed in incommensurate misfit compounds, e.g., ${(\text{LaSe})}_{1.14}({\mathrm{NbSe}}_{2}{)}_{2}$, are due to interlayer charge transfer. By contrast, our analysis, based on both angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy (ARPES) measurements and a spe…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206202] Published Fri Nov 14, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Drake Niedzielski, Brendan D. Faeth, Berit H. Goodge, Mekhola Sinha, Tyrel M. McQueen, Lena F. Kourkoutis, and Tomás A. Arias

Common belief is that the large band shifts observed in incommensurate misfit compounds, e.g., (LaSe)1.14(NbSe2)2, are due to interlayer charge transfer. By contrast, our analysis, based on both angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy (ARPES) measurements and a specialized ab initio framework empl…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206202] Published Fri Nov 14, 2025
item.dc:title: Unmasking Charge Transfer in the Misfits: ARPES and Ab Initio Prediction of Electronic Structure in Layered Incommensurate Systems without Artificial Strain
item.dc:creator: Drake Niedzielski, Brendan D. Faeth, Berit H. Goodge, Mekhola Sinha, Tyrel M. McQueen, Lena F. Kourkoutis, and Tomás A. Arias

item.title: Emerging Non-Hermitian Topology in a Chiral-Driven-Dissipative Bose-Hubbard Model
item.description:
Author(s): Laszlo Rassaert, Tomás Ramos, Tommaso Roscilde, and Diego Porras

We introduce a driven-dissipative Bose-Hubbard chain describing coupled lossy photonic modes, in which time-reversal symmetry is broken by a coherent drive with a uniform phase gradient. We investigate this model by means of a Gaussian variational ansatz and numerically prove that the steady-state s…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 203603] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Laszlo Rassaert, Tomás Ramos, Tommaso Roscilde, and Diego Porras

We introduce a driven-dissipative Bose-Hubbard chain describing coupled lossy photonic modes, in which time-reversal symmetry is broken by a coherent drive with a uniform phase gradient. We investigate this model by means of a Gaussian variational ansatz and numerically prove that the steady-state s…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 203603] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.dc:title: Emerging Non-Hermitian Topology in a Chiral-Driven-Dissipative Bose-Hubbard Model

item.title: Polarization-Driven Charge Frustration and Emergent Phases in the One-Dimensional Extended Hubbard Model
item.description:
Author(s): Sourabh Saha, Jeroen van den Brink, Manoranjan Kumar, and Satoshi Nishimoto

Charge frustration stemming from polarization-induced competing interactions drives unconventional insulating behavior in a one-dimensional extended Hubbard model.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206504] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Sourabh Saha, Jeroen van den Brink, Manoranjan Kumar, and Satoshi Nishimoto

Charge frustration stemming from polarization-induced competing interactions drives unconventional insulating behavior in a one-dimensional extended Hubbard model.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206504] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025

item.title: Superballistic Paradox in Electron Fluids: Relevance of Tomographic Transport
item.description:
Author(s): Jorge Estrada-Álvarez, Elena Díaz, and Francisco Domínguez-Adame

Electron hydrodynamics encompasses the exotic fluidlike behavior of electrons in two-dimensional materials such as graphene. It accounts for superballistic conduction, also known as the Gurzhi effect, where increasing temperature reduces the electrical resistance. In analogy with conventional fluids…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206301] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Jorge Estrada-Álvarez, Elena Díaz, and Francisco Domínguez-Adame

Electron hydrodynamics encompasses the exotic fluidlike behavior of electrons in two-dimensional materials such as graphene. It accounts for superballistic conduction, also known as the Gurzhi effect, where increasing temperature reduces the electrical resistance. In analogy with conventional fluids…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206301] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025

item.title: Effects of Landau Level Mixing on Various Fractional Quantum Hall States in Trilayer Graphene
item.description:
Author(s): Simrandeep Kaur, Harsimran Singh, Kenji Watanabe, Takashi Taniguchi, Unmesh Ghorai, Manish Jain, Rajdeep Sensarma, and Aveek Bid

We present a detailed experimental study of the effect of Landau level mixing on various fractional quantum Hall states (FQHs) about half filling in a multiband system, namely, Bernal stacked trilayer graphene (TLG). In pristine TLG, the excitation energy gaps, Landé $g$ factor, effective mass, and …


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206501] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Simrandeep Kaur, Harsimran Singh, Kenji Watanabe, Takashi Taniguchi, Unmesh Ghorai, Manish Jain, Rajdeep Sensarma, and Aveek Bid

We present a detailed experimental study of the effect of Landau level mixing on various fractional quantum Hall states (FQHs) about half filling in a multiband system, namely, Bernal stacked trilayer graphene (TLG). In pristine TLG, the excitation energy gaps, Landé g factor, effective mass, and di…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206501] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.dc:title: Effects of Landau Level Mixing on Various Fractional Quantum Hall States in Trilayer Graphene

item.title: Non-Hermitian Numerical Renormalization Group: Solution of the Non-Hermitian Kondo Model
item.description:
Author(s): Phillip C. Burke and Andrew K. Mitchell

Non-Hermitian (NH) Hamiltonians describe open quantum systems, nonequilibrium dynamics, and dissipative processes. Although a rich range of single-particle NH physics has been uncovered, many-body phenomena in strongly correlated NH systems have been far less well studied. The Kondo effect, an impor…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206502] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Phillip C. Burke and Andrew K. Mitchell

Non-Hermitian (NH) Hamiltonians describe open quantum systems, nonequilibrium dynamics, and dissipative processes. Although a rich range of single-particle NH physics has been uncovered, many-body phenomena in strongly correlated NH systems have been far less well studied. The Kondo effect, an impor…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206502] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.dc:title: Non-Hermitian Numerical Renormalization Group: Solution of the Non-Hermitian Kondo Model

item.title: Anomalous Nodal Gap in a Doped Spin-$1/2$ Antiferromagnetic Mott Insulator
item.description:
Author(s): Yong Hu, Christopher Lane, Xiang Chen, Shuting Peng, Zeliang Sun, Makoto Hashimoto, Donghui Lu, Tao Wu, Robert S. Markiewicz, Xianhui Chen, Arun Bansil, Stephen D. Wilson, and Junfeng He

Many emergent phenomena appear in doped Mott insulators near the insulator-to-metal transition. In high-temperature cuprate superconductors, superconductivity arises when antiferromagnetic (AFM) order is gradually suppressed by carrier doping, and a $d$-wave superconducting gap forms when an enigmat…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196403] Published Fri Nov 07, 2025

Author(s): Yong Hu, Christopher Lane, Xiang Chen, Shuting Peng, Zeliang Sun, Makoto Hashimoto, Donghui Lu, Tao Wu, Robert S. Markiewicz, Xianhui Chen, Arun Bansil, Stephen D. Wilson, and Junfeng He

Many emergent phenomena appear in doped Mott insulators near the insulator-to-metal transition. In high-temperature cuprate superconductors, superconductivity arises when antiferromagnetic (AFM) order is gradually suppressed by carrier doping, and a d-wave superconducting gap forms when an enigmatic…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196403] Published Fri Nov 07, 2025
